qas.question: In June 1989 who was Nintendo of America's vice president of marketing?
In 1990, what percentage of American households owned an NES?
What was the slogan for the Nintendo brand?
What outsold the NES in Europe and South America?
In June 1987 who was Nintendo of America's vice president of marketing?
In 1990, what percentage of American households owned a SNES?
What wasn't the slogan for the Nintendo brand?
What outsold the NES in Europe and South Africa?

context: In June 1989, Nintendo of America's vice president of marketing <a0_0><b5_0>Peter Main<b5_0/><a0_0/>, said that the Famicom was present in 37% of Japan's households. By 1990, <a1_0><b6_0>30%<b6_0/><a1_0/> of American households owned the NES, compared to 23% for all personal computers. By 1990, the NES had outsold all previously released consoles worldwide.[better source needed] The slogan for this brand was <a2_0><b7_0>It can't be beaten<b7_0/><a2_0/>. In Europe and South America, however, the NES was outsold by <a3_0><b8_0>Sega's Master System<b8_0/><a3_0/>, while the Nintendo Entertainment System was not available in the <a4_0><b9_0>Soviet Union<b9_0/><a4_0/>.
